External Identifiers for Drugs/ Carriers/ Enzymes/ Targets/ Transporters

Source: R/data.R
ext_id.Rd

Identifiers used in other websites or databases providing information about this drug.

External_Identifiers_Drug

External_Identifiers_Polypeptide_Carrier_Drug

External_Identifiers_Polypeptide_Enzyme_Drug

External_Identifiers_Polypeptide_Target_Drug

External_Identifiers_Transporter_Drug

Format

a tibble with following features:

resource

Name of the source database

identifier

Identifier for this drug in the given resource

parent_key

drugbank key

An object of class spec_tbl_df (inherits from tbl_df, tbl, data.frame) with 82974 rows and 3 columns.

An object of class spec_tbl_df (inherits from tbl_df, tbl, data.frame) with 424 rows and 3 columns.

An object of class spec_tbl_df (inherits from tbl_df, tbl, data.frame) with 2365 rows and 3 columns.

An object of class spec_tbl_df (inherits from tbl_df, tbl, data.frame) with 21770 rows and 3 columns.

An object of class spec_tbl_df (inherits from tbl_df, tbl, data.frame) with 1287 rows and 3 columns.

Source

Drugbank Documentation

Details

Each drug may have one or more external identifier.

Drug identifiers may be provided for the following resources

  • Wikipedia

  • ChEBI

  • ChEMBL

  • PubChem Compound

  • PubChem Substance

  • Drugs Product Database (DPD)

  • KEGG Compound

  • KEGG Compound

  • KEGG Drug

  • ChemSpider

  • BindingDB

  • National Drug Code Directory

  • GenBank

  • PharmGKB

  • PDB

  • Guide to Pharmacology

  • ZINC

  • RxCUI
